title: Fix: miden-client dependency features
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

URGENT: Cargo.toml has invalid features for miden-client.

Current (broken):
miden-client = { version = "0.12", features = ["tonic", "concurrent"] }

The 'concurrent' feature doesn't exist in miden-client 0.12.x.

Fix by removing invalid features or finding correct ones.
Check crates.io or miden-client docs for valid features.

title: Receipt Management
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement transaction receipt tracking:
- Map synthetic Eth tx hashes to Miden transaction IDs
- Implement miden_tx_to_eth_receipt() per spec line 184-205
- Poll Miden state for confirmation status
- Return Ethereum-formatted receipts with:
  - transaction_hash, block_number, block_hash
  - status 0x1 on success
  - to = BRIDGE_CONTRACT_ADDRESS
close_reason: Implemented receipt management: TxHashMap, miden_tx_to_eth_receipt(), status tracking, polling. 6 tests passing.

title: Miden Client Integration
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Integrate with Miden client:
- Initialize miden-client with node endpoint
- Create P2ID notes for claim distribution
- Submit transactions via TransactionRequestBuilder
- Sync state to track confirmations

Key function: create_bridge_claim_note() per spec line 122-145
Need bridge faucet account for asset distribution.
close_reason: Miden client integration complete: P2ID note creation, TransactionRequestBuilder, state sync

title: Claim Tracking and Deduplication
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement claim deduplication:
- Track globalIndex values to prevent replay attacks
- Use thread-safe storage (DashSet per spec line 383-396)
- Reject duplicate claims with AlreadyClaimed error
- Persist claimed indices across restarts

This is security-critical for replay prevention.
close_reason: Implemented ClaimTracker module with DashSet storage, persistence, and tests. All 10 tests passing.

title: Proxy still not responding - investigate docker-compose.local.yml setup
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Pre-flight checks fail with 'Proxy not responding at http://localhost:8546'. Previous fix added env vars LISTEN_HOST/LISTEN_PORT but proxy still not working. Need to: 1) Check docker logs proxy 2) Verify env vars are being passed in docker-compose.local.yml 3) Test with ./scripts/start-all.sh --clean then ./scripts/test-lumia-claims.sh 1

title: Convert Tests to Rust using miden-client
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

URGENT: Current tests are Python/pytest but must be Rust using miden-client library.

Convert all tests to Rust:
- Phase 1 tests: TC-1.1 to TC-1.7 (node connectivity, accounts, P2ID)
- Phase 2 tests: TC-2.1 to TC-2.5 (CLAIM notes, faucet)
- Phase 3 tests: TC-3.1 to TC-3.9 (integration)

Use:
- miden-client crate for Miden operations
- tokio for async
- std Rust testing framework (#[test], #[tokio::test])

Place tests in tests/ directory as Rust integration tests.
Entry: cargo test (via make test)

title: Fix miden-node URL in Docker: use service name not localhost
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Inside Docker, proxy uses localhost:57291 but should use miden-node:57291 (the Docker service name). Error: 'rpc api error' when calling GetBlockHeaderByNumber. The MIDEN_RPC_URL env var is set in docker-compose.local.yml but code defaults to localhost. Need to ensure the Docker compose passes MIDEN_RPC_URL=http://miden-node:57291

title: Phase 2 Tests - CLAIM Notes
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement Phase 2 tests per test spec Section 4:
- TC-2.1: AggLayer Faucet Deployment
- TC-2.2: Bridge Account Deployment
- TC-2.3: CLAIM Note Creation (567 Felts)
- TC-2.4: CLAIM Execution Happy Path
- TC-2.5: CLAIM Output Verification
- TC-2.6: Recipient Consumption
- TC-2.7-2.9: Invalid CLAIM tests
- TC-2.10: globalIndex Decoding

Entry: make test-phase2
close_reason: Phase 2 tests implemented: TC-2.1 through TC-2.10. Tests cover faucet/bridge deployment, CLAIM note creation (567 Felts), execution, output verification, consumption, invalid claims, and globalIndex decoding.

title: Phase 3 Tests - Full Integration
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement Phase 3 tests per test spec Section 5:
- TC-3.1-3.4: Proxy RPC method tests
- TC-3.5: L1 Deposit Simulation
- TC-3.6: Bridge Service Sync
- TC-3.7: claimtxman Sends Claim
- TC-3.8: Proxy Transaction Processing
- TC-3.9: Miden State Verification
- TC-3.10-3.11: Receipt Polling/Format
- TC-3.12-3.15: Error cases, Replay Prevention

Requires: L1 devnet (Anvil), Bridge service, full topology.
Entry: make test-phase3, make test
close_reason: Phase 3 tests implemented: TC-3.1 through TC-3.15. Branch polecat/ace-mkec4sdx pushed.

title: Fix proxy not responding to claimAsset requests
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

When running ./scripts/test-lumia-claims.sh, the proxy receives the request but does nothing - no response, no logs. The miden-node is running and healthy. Need to investigate why proxy isn't processing claimAsset RPC calls. Test with: docker compose -f docker-compose.local.yml up -d && ./scripts/test-lumia-claims.sh 1

title: Restore genesis.toml requirement in Dockerfile
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

miden-node bundled bootstrap requires --genesis-config-file. Restore:
1. config/genesis.toml with default content (native faucet, fee params, wallets)
2. COPY config/genesis.toml in Dockerfile
3. --genesis-config-file flag in entrypoint bootstrap command

Use this minimal genesis.toml:
```toml
timestamp = 1717344256
version   = 1

[native_faucet]
decimals   = 3
max_supply = 100_000_000
symbol     = "MIDEN"

[fee_parameters]
verification_base_fee = 0

[[wallet]]
assets       = [{ amount = 999_000, symbol = "MIDEN" }]
storage_mode = "private"

[[wallet]]
assets       = [{ amount = 777, symbol = "MIDEN" }]
storage_mode = "private"
```

title: Remove genesis patching from Dockerfile - use default genesis
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Default miden genesis is sufficient. Remove the add-agglayer-genesis.sh patch from Dockerfile.miden-node.

title: Deacon Patrol
description: Mayor's daemon patrol loop for handling callbacks, health checks, and cleanup.

title: Add commit SHA/version to proxy startup logs
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Add git commit SHA to proxy startup banner so user can verify they're running the latest build. Show something like:
Version: abc1234 (built 2026-01-15)
This helps debug 'am I running the right version?' issues.

title: claimAsset TX fails with RLP decoding overflow error
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

When sending claimAsset transactions, proxy returns: {"error":{"code":-32602,"message":"Transaction decode error: RLP decoding failed: overflow"}}. The RLP decoding of the Lumia bridge claim transactions is failing. May need to review how the proxy handles the bridge claim data structure.

title: Document how to get BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID from miden-node
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

User needs to know where to get BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID. It comes from miden-node genesis. Need to:
1. Check miden-node bootstrap logs for faucet account IDs
2. Or query the node for available faucets
3. Document in docs/TESTING.md how to get this value
4. Consider adding it to start-all.sh output

title: Use default genesis in Dockerfile.miden-node
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Remove custom genesis.toml usage. Use miden-node default genesis instead:
- Remove --genesis-config-file from bootstrap command
- Remove COPY config/genesis.toml
- Remove genesis.toml debug output in entrypoint

title: Add RLP-encoded signed Lumia test transactions
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

The test script currently sends raw claimAsset calldata. We need to also have full RLP-encoded signed Ethereum transactions from Lumia chain for testing both code paths (raw calldata vs RLP transactions).
close_reason: Merged to main - RLP-encoded test transactions

title: Test Infrastructure - Docker/Kurtosis
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Set up test infrastructure:
- Dockerfile for proxy
- docker-compose.yml for local testing
- Kurtosis package (miden_proxy.star) per spec
- Test runner container
- Environment isolation

Services needed:
- miden-node (port 57291)
- l1-anvil (port 8545)
- proxy (port 8546)
- bridge-service (port 8080)
- postgres (port 5432)

Single command: make test must work

title: Spec Audit: Missing modules from main branch
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

CRITICAL: Main branch missing spec-required modules:

1. address_mapper.rs - Eth to Miden address mapping
   - In capable worktree, not merged
   
2. decode.rs - Transaction and claimAsset decoding
   - In dementus worktree, not merged
   
3. claim_tracker.rs - Deduplication using DashSet
   - In cheedo worktree, not merged

lib.rs needs to export these modules.
Refinery must merge these branches to main.

title: JSON-RPC Server Implementation
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement jsonrpsee server with these methods:
- eth_chainId: Return configured Miden chain ID
- eth_gasPrice: Return static 0x0
- eth_estimateGas: Return fixed estimate
- eth_getTransactionCount: Track synthetic nonces per account
- eth_sendRawTransaction: Main claim processing (separate task)
- eth_getTransactionReceipt: Map Miden tx status to Eth receipt
- eth_call: Simulate bridge state queries
- eth_blockNumber: Return Miden block height

Use jsonrpsee macros for server definition.

title: Use persistent miden client to create and submit claim notes
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

We have a persistent miden client for block numbers. Extend it to:
1. When claimAsset TX is received, use the miden client to create a claim note
2. Submit the note to miden network
3. Return the note/tx hash to the caller

The client is already initialized at startup and used in fetch_block_height(). Need to make it available for claim submission too.

title: Spec Audit: Update miden crate versions to 0.13
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

CRITICAL: Cargo.toml uses miden-* version 0.12 but agglayer-v0.1 requires version 0.13.

Update in Cargo.toml:
- miden-client = { version = "0.13", features = ["tonic", "testing"] }
- miden-objects = "0.13"
- miden-lib = "0.13"
- miden-crypto = "0.13"

Docker images should use: ghcr.io/0xmiden/miden-node:agglayer-v0.1

title: Witness Patrol
description: Per-rig worker monitor patrol loop with progressive nudging.

title: eth_blockNumber always returns 0x0 instead of actual block height
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Proxy returns 0x0 for eth_blockNumber even when miden-node is on block 75+. The proxy is not correctly querying the miden-node for block height, or the translation from miden block numbers to eth format is wrong.

title: Revert to agglayer-v0.1 with minimal default genesis.toml
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Revert Dockerfile.miden-node back to agglayer-v0.1 branch, but use a minimal default genesis.toml:

1. Change branch back from 'main' to 'agglayer-v0.1'
2. Update label back to agglayer-v0.1
3. Add config/genesis.toml with minimal default content:
```toml
timestamp = 1717344256
version   = 1

[native_faucet]
decimals   = 3
max_supply = 100_000_000
symbol     = "MIDEN"

[fee_parameters]
verification_base_fee = 0

[[wallet]]
assets       = [{ amount = 999_000, symbol = "MIDEN" }]
storage_mode = "private"
```
4. Add back COPY config/genesis.toml /app/genesis.toml
5. Add back --genesis-config-file to bootstrap command

title: Phase 1 Tests - Miden Standalone
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement Phase 1 tests per test spec Section 3:
- TC-1.1: Node Connectivity
- TC-1.2: Account Creation (Alice, Bob)
- TC-1.3: Faucet Deployment
- TC-1.4: Token Minting
- TC-1.5: Note Consumption
- TC-1.6: P2ID Transfer
- TC-1.7: State Consistency

Must run in ephemeral Docker/Kurtosis environment.
Entry: make test-phase1

title: Fix miden client initialization: unable to open database file
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Proxy fails with: 'unable to open database file: /tmp/miden-rpc-proxy-client'. The miden_client needs SQLite storage but the path doesn't exist or has permission issues in Docker. Need to:
1. Ensure the directory exists before creating client
2. Or use a path that works in Docker (e.g., /app/data or a mounted volume)
3. Test that proxy starts and connects to miden-node successfully

title: CI Build Gating
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Set up GitHub Actions workflow for build gating:
- Run on every PR
- cargo build --release
- cargo clippy
- cargo fmt --check
- Block merge if build fails

File: .github/workflows/ci.yml

No tests required in gate, just successful build.

title: Print config table on proxy startup
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Print all config values as a table on startup for debugging:
- MIDEN_RPC_URL
- BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID
- LISTEN_HOST / LISTEN_PORT
- Any other env vars
Format as nice table in logs so it's easy to see at a glance.

title: Transaction Decoding
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement transaction decoding:
1. RLP decode raw Ethereum transactions using alloy-consensus
2. Parse claimAsset ABI calldata (selector 0x2cffd02e)
3. Extract parameters per spec Appendix B layout
4. Decode globalIndex bit fields:
   - mainnetFlag at bit 64
   - rollupIndex bits 32-63
   - localRootIndex bits 0-31

Handle both valid claims and reject non-claim transactions.
close_reason: Implemented transaction decoding with claimAsset ABI parsing and globalIndex bit field decoding

title: Merge: valkyrie-mkec37jx
description:
branch: polecat/valkyrie-mkec37jx
target: main
source_issue: valkyrie-mkec37jx
rig: miden

title: Fix BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID format - invalid hex parsing
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Error: 'Invalid bridge faucet ID: Invalid account ID hex: failed to parse hex string into account ID'

The faucet ID extracted from SQLite database is not in the correct format for miden client. Need to:
1. Check what format miden client expects (likely 16 bytes / 32 hex chars with 0x prefix?)
2. Fix the SQL query or post-processing in start-all.sh to produce correct format
3. May need to pad or format the hex string correctly

title: miden
description:
Rig identity bead for miden.

repo: git@github.com:mandrigin/aggkit-proxy.git
prefix: mi
state: active

title: Build Infrastructure Setup
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Set up Cargo.toml with all dependencies from spec, Makefile with build/test targets, README with build instructions. Must enable deterministic builds on clean checkout.

Dependencies (from spec):
- jsonrpsee 0.26 with server/macros
- tokio 1 with full
- tower 0.5, tower-http 0.6 with cors
- alloy-primitives 0.8, alloy-rlp 0.3, alloy-rpc-types 0.8, alloy-consensus 0.8
- miden-client 0.12 with tonic/concurrent
- miden-client-sqlite-store 0.12
- miden-objects 0.12, miden-lib 0.12, miden-crypto 0.13
- serde 1 with derive, serde_json 1, hex 0.4
- anyhow 1, thiserror 2, tracing 0.1, tracing-subscriber 0.3

Makefile targets: build, test, test-phase1, test-phase2, test-phase3, test-docker
close_reason: Build infrastructure complete: Cargo.toml, Makefile, README, src/lib.rs

title: Core Types and Config
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Define core types:
- ClaimAssetParams struct (from spec line 63-88)
- ProxyConfig for TOML config loading
- Custom error types with thiserror

Config should include:
- listen_port (default 8545)
- miden_rpc_url
- chain_id
- bridge_account_id
close_reason: Core types complete: ClaimAssetParams, ProxyConfig, error types

title: Fix: Use miden-node agglayer-v0.1 tag
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

URGENT: Tests must use correct miden-node version.

Correct tag: https://github.com/0xMiden/miden-node/tree/agglayer-v0.1

Update:
1. docker-compose.yml - use ghcr.io/0xmiden/miden-node:agglayer-v0.1 
2. docker-compose.test.yml - same
3. Kurtosis package - same
4. README - document the version requirement

The miden-client dependencies should also match the node version.

title: Fix eth_blockNumber: persist miden client, fetch on-demand instead of polling
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Current polling approach fails with: 'unable to open database file: /tmp/miden-block-height-poller-store'. Instead of polling:
1. Persist miden_client as part of the server state
2. When eth_blockNumber is called, use the persistent client to get actual block height
3. No polling needed - performance not relevant, just fetch on-demand
4. Remove the polling task entirely

title: Refinery Patrol
description: Merge queue processor patrol loop with verification gates.

title: Documentation - README and Demo Guide
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Create exhaustive documentation:
- README.md with:
  - Overview and architecture diagram
  - Build instructions (cargo build)
  - Configuration options
  - Running locally
  - Demo guide (one-command test)
- ARCHITECTURE.md with proxy internals
- API.md with JSON-RPC method docs

User must be able to test and demo in one run.

title: Address Mapping (Eth to Miden)
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement address mapping between Ethereum and Miden:
- Miden uses 120-bit AccountIds vs Ethereum 160-bit addresses
- Implement Option 3 from spec: Auto-create accounts
- When claim arrives for unknown address, create new Miden wallet account
- Store mapping persistently (SQLite or in-memory with persistence)

Use deterministic derivation as fallback:
eth_address -> keccak256 -> seed -> AccountId

title: Fix: BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID env var not being read correctly
description:
dispatched_by: mayor

BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID is passed to proxy (verified with docker inspect) but proxy still logs 'Miden submission config not available'. The env var is not being read or used correctly.

To reproduce:
1. ./scripts/start-all.sh --clean
2. ./scripts/test-lumia-claims.sh 1
3. Check proxy logs - still shows 'Miden submission config not available'

The code that reads BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID and initializes MidenSubmissionConfig is not working as expected.

comments.author: miden/polecats/nightrider
comments.text: RESOLVED: Not a code bug - stale Docker image. Container was running old code without config table. Rebuild with 'docker compose build --no-cache proxy' fixed it. Code correctly reads BRIDGE_FAUCET_ID via std::env::var() at main.rs:925. Verified with test-lumia-claims.sh - successful tx hash returned.
